qas.question: There was a 16th century Huguenot settlement near what modern day Florida city?
Who was the leader who established the colony at Florida?
What was the name of the Florida Huguenot colony?
Which army attacked and destroyed this colony?
In what year was Jean Ribault born?
How many Huguenots did Pedro Menendez have murdered  at  St Augustine?
How many Huguenots were there in Fort Caroline?
From where had the Norman Huguenots sailed in order to arrive at Fort Caroline?

context: In <b5_0>1564<b5_0/> a group of Norman Huguenots under the leadership of <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>Jean Ribault<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> established the small colony of <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>Fort Caroline<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> on the banks of the St. Johns River in what is today <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>Jacksonville<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, Florida. The effort was the first at any permanent European settlement in the present-day continental United States, but survived only a short time. A September <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>1565<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> French naval attack against the new Spanish colony at St. Augustine failed when its ships were hit by a hurricane on their way to the <a3_0>Spanish<a3_0/> encampment at <b8_0>Fort Matanzas<b8_0/>. <b6_0><b7_0>Hundreds<b7_0/><b6_0/> of French soldiers were stranded and surrendered to the numerically inferior <a3_1><a3_2>Spanish<a3_2/><a3_1/> forces led by Pedro Menendez. Menendez proceeded to massacre the defenseless Huguenots, after which he wiped out the Fort Caroline garrison.
